# Encryption master

> Alright. Serious talk. You need to work pretty hard for this one (unless you are an encryption god.) Well, good luck. 

The given file says:

```
This is NOT going to be fun.


```

Notice the `=` characters at the end: it's base64. Decoded:

```
Nice! Now keep going.


```

Seems like hexadecimal (as there are no characters larger than `f`). Indeed!

```
Two more.

01000110 01101001 01101110 01100001 01101100 00100000 01000100 01100101 01100011 01110010 01111001 01110000 01110100 01101001 01101111 01101110 00100001 00100000 01010001 00110001 01010010 01000111 01100101 00110000 01101100 01100110 01010001 01010101 00110001 01100110 01010101 01000110 01001010 01010000 01010110 01010101 01010010 01100110 01010100 00110000 01011010 01100110 01010111 01010101 00111001 01010110 01100110 01010001 00111101 00111101
```

Obviously binary:

```
Final Decryption! Q1RGe0lfQU1fUFJPVURfT0ZfWU9VfQ==
```

Base64 again (notice the `=` characters...):

```
CTF{I_AM_PROUD_OF_YOU}
```

Turns out this was really about encoding, not about encryption.
